I changed my mind.
text in default

He caught this signal in the factory, located in the same area as one of the exits to the spatial anomaly. That's where we found you. I think these messages are coming from people who, like you, got stuck inside the space anomaly.
I'll be glad to help. Might be able to save Marcus too. One question, though: how exactly are you going to pull them out?
It's simple, really: before leaving, Forester gave me the exact coordinates to the anomaly exit. We just have to send it to the stalkers trapped inside.
Sure. If you have the transmitter, I'll do it.

Excellent. I knew I could count on you. I'll give you the transmitter, and you'll take it to the right spot and send them the coordinates. Don't worry; the device already has all the data recorded in its memory. All you have to do is send it to the stalkers on the other side. If they get our signal, they should be able to find their way out.
All right. Give me the transmitter. I'll send them the coordinates.
So, did you do what I asked?
Not yet.
Greetings, merc! Need anything fixed?
You're awake, Beast. Good. We were really worrying about you for a while. What the hell happened to you at the factory?
I transmitted the coordinates, but they fell into the wrong hands. It wasn't such a good idea. Can't do anything about it now, though.
Beast, what the hell are you talking about?
There's no time to go into detail, but it's likely that all of us are in grave danger.
If it's an attack, we'll can fight it off with ease, considering the massive protection we have here.
I hope that's the case. Anyway, here's your transmitter.
All right, then… By the way, I unlocked the PDA you brought me here before. I read what's in there and gave it to Saurel. Hope you don't mind.
I don't mind. What sort of info was there?
Go talk to Saurel. He'll tell you everything in full detail. I have to get back to work.
Fine. I'll go see him, then.
Greetings, merc! You need anything repaired?
Hey, Beast. I take it you're here about the PDA.
Yeah. That's right.

Just so you know, Saurel is sending you on a very dangerous mission. But what can you do, right? We all put our lives at stake here every single day.\n \nAll right. I made some changes to your PDA. Now the Monolith will think you're one of their own. By the way, you don't have to worry about friendly fire, since everyone in the base was warned you two were going undercover. We also informed the hunter team nearby, so there should be no problem with them either. Good luck out there.
Thanks. See you later.
Greetings, merc! You need anything repaired?
Hey, merc. Are you here on business?
Damn, Beast. You look like shit… Did you manage to stop the Monolith? Also, where's Savage?

The bastards took him captive and hid him inside the laboratory, thinking I'd go after him. They must've prepared some kind of trap for me. I'm not going, though, since he's dead either way. I'm not gonna throw my life away for nothing.
Fuck, man… Poor Savage. In my opinion, though, you made the right choice. For all we know, Savage is already dead.
Can you reset my PDA, Petrovich?
Sure thing. Let's see… Here you go. Good as new. So where are you off to now?
I'll go talk to Hunter. I was told by Saurel he's ready to leave the Outpost, and I'm going with them…
In that case, Beast, goodbye. This might be the last time we see each other.
Goodbye, Petrovich.
Goodbye, Beast. This might be the last time we see each other.
Hey, Petrovich, can you hack this PDA?
I can try. I've done it before. But I can't promise anything.
All right. Here's the PDA. Give it a shot.

Sure. I'll have a look. Listen, Beast: I have a favor to ask you. I haven't told this to anyone; not even to Saurel. I've been catching a distress signal on my radio that's being transmitted on a hidden frequency. After a while, I couldn't pick it up anymore, but then a stalker came to me and said he was catching that same signal when he was near the factory. At first, I didn't believe him, but he brought me a recording that convinced me otherwise.
And? Where are you going with this?
Hey, Antibiotic, can you give me the Chimera figurine? The one on your table?
Sorry, but I'm not giving it away like that. Now, if you're willing to place a bid on it, that's a different story.
A thousand? Don't you think it's worth a bit more than that? Fifteen hundred at the very least.
So be it. I'll sell it to you for fifteen hundred.
Here you go.
And here's your figurine. Don't lose it; it's a unique piece. Only one in the world.
Thanks. Good day to you.
For two thousand, it's all yours.
All right. Here's the cash.
And how much do you want for it?
How much will you give?
I'll give you five hundred rubles.
I'll give you a thousand rubles.
I'll give you fifteen hundred rubles.
I'll give you two thousand rubles.
Money's tight right now.
That's way too small of a sum. Maybe you can place a higher bid?
Do you need any help?

It's a good thing you asked. I have something I need taken care of; someone tried to help me with this before, but he couldn't find anything substantial. The thing is: I need your help with completing a collection.
What sort of collection?

Way back when, we had a guy at the Outpost who would make figurines; it was his hobby.
 
At one point, he got the idea to make a figurine for the mutants in the Zone, and since he had such a good photographic memory, his results were very accurate. After a while, the guy disappeared somewhere, but his figurines remained; he sold all of them to the local stalkers. I started to develop a liking for those figurines when I got my hands on the bloodsucker sculpture, and after that, I wanted to complete the entire collection. Perhaps if you look around the stashes at the Outpost and ask around, you can find something.
 
So what do you say? Help me out here? I'll give you a thousand rubles for each figurine you find.
All right. I'll try and look for them.
Sorry. I don't have the time.
If you want to help, then help me complete my collection. You'll help me out a lot if you find a few at least.
All right. I'll try and look for them.
I'm still short on time. I'm not going to do that.
About the figurine collection…
Yeah? You find any figurines?
I found a pseudogiant.
I found a snork.
Excellent. Here's your reward, merc; just as we agreed. Is that all, or have you found any other figurine?
You already have all the mutant figurines.

Oh? Oh. I didn't notice that you already found all the figurines. Excellent work, merc. Thank you so much for your help. As a token of my gratitude—besides the money—I'll give you a forty percent discount on all repairs and modifications.
Well, thanks for the discount. See you.
Not yet.
I found a blind dog.
I found a pseudodog.
I found a boar.
I found a flesh.
I found a burer.
I found a controller.
I found a chimera.
Rasputin, can you give me the pseudogiant figurines that's on that shelf?
What do you need it for? It doesn't just sit there, you know. It's part of my bar's entourage, and I've gotten used to it being there for so long.
Petrovich asked me to find figurines of all mutants in the Zone. You have one of them.
I'll give it to you for a thousand. No questions asked.

He's been begging for it for quite a while. I was going to give it away, but he already sent you on a hunt for all the figurines. So if he really wants it, then take it. I'll get something else to replace it.
Well, okay. If you need it so badly, take it. Was just curious why you needed it…
Thanks. You've really helped me out. See you.
Doesn't really matter to me. Later.
Yo, man! You wanna take a few shots at the ravens?
I do.
Great. You can play my games just for fun, earn some money, or try to score a record. Take your pick.
Nah. I don't feel like it.
'Kay, man. I'm always here if you change your mind.
Here's your stuff, like we agreed. All fair and square. So, you wanna go for some more?
It really do be like that sometimes. You wanna try again?
Where the hell were you going, man? Shooting behind the fence? That ain't part of the game. Maybe you wanna have a go by the rules this time?
Clock's ticking! Less babbling, more shooting!
Got it.
You shoot like a real man! You should go for money. Want to try again?
I'll do it for money.
Now that's what I like to hear! I don't need to go over the rules with you, do I?
Yeah. Let's start.
Not just yet, bro! So what do you think? How many of them birdies can you get in a minute?
Sure.
All right, man. Ready your gun.
Yeah.
I don't have that much money.
Well, can you choose something that'll fit your pocket?
Yeah. I'll pick a different amount of ravens.
No. Not interested.
Then you can play just for fun. Or for records… but that'll drain your pockets dry. What do you say?
Tell me the rules.

Playing for money's the most fun. You tell me how many ravens you can take out in a minute, you place your bets, and you step forward. If you win your bet, you get double the sum. If you lose, the paper's all mine. And keep in mind: the more birdies, the bigger the bet.
Mmm… I don't feel like playing anymore.
Are there any general rules?

Basically none. I keep time, you get ready for the signal, then rain fire. If you manage to get as many as you bet within a minute, you win. You choose how you want to take out the birds out. Just remember that if you leave the fence, the game's off. So what'll it be: fun, money, or record time?
Eh. I don't like it.
Okay, then. If anything, I'm always here.
I'll try scoring a record.
Let's go.
Agreed.
Now let's see what skills you got!
Agreed, but no money.
Then a few simpler choices: money or just for fun. What do you say?
I've changed my mind.
Remind me of the rules.

This is for the real boys. If you feel you got the strength to score the highest record, you place a bet, and not a small one, either. If you get it, I'll give you back the money you bet with twice on top… and also the title of champion, which ain't so fucking bad. If not, I keep the paper.
I've changed my mind.
Just for fun.
Some exercise, huh? You got the rules?
Yes. Let's shoot.
'Kay. How many ravens are you getting?
Sure. Well, don't just stand there. Shoot.
Yep.
No. Tell me.

Well, you wanna try shooting crows just for fun. Meaning you don't wanna earn any cash. You just wanna train, or you might be feeling down. You choose how many ravens you drop within a minute, and you try to get it done.
I've changed my mind.
Not a question. Your choices are the same: for money or for a record. What do you say?
Greetings, sir. What were you doing on the tree?
What? Got a problem?
No, God forbid. Everything is fine. If you give us the artifact you found in the grove, though, it'll be even better.
Oh, fuck off… You better leave before I put a bullet between your eyes.
I'm not giving you anything. Go back to where you came from.
All right. Take the artifact and be on your way.
That's it! We're feeling nice today, so be thankful that we don't strip your clothes and make you walk around the Zone naked.
Uh-huh…
We're out. Now listen up: head to the old school in the morning. I'll be waiting there with my pals. I meet you there, you get your shooters. And remember: we never had this conversation.
And I know what to do without you.
Perfect. Take the key. Got no time to waste, so we'll scram. Gonna wait for you where we've agreed.
I'll see you later.
'Sup, merc! Thanks again for helping us out of that hole.
Let's not beat around the bush. You got my weapons?
Of course. I keep my word… These babies are brand new; haven't even been fired yet. Everything is just right. By the way, I hope nobody caught word of our deal yesterday?
No. Everything went fine. Give me the guns.
They're all yours. Here. And some more info for ya: go see Bookmaker in the yard. He can organize some real fun for you. Not to mention there's money in it.
Great. I'll talk to him.
Look who showed up.
He he. Just try and get me. So we have a deal? I'll wait for the key at nighttime.
Yeah. We have a deal.
So did you retrieve the key?
Yes. I have the key.
Still haven't found it.
Beautiful, merc. Give it to me. Time's short, and we need to get out of here without a sound.
Hold your horses. How are we going to return the key back to where it was?

I know: we'll meet by the house. You go off now and wait for me there while I open this cell with my bro and sneak out in your direction. I'll mark the exact place for you, where I'll give you the key.
And when will I get the gun?
Hey, merc! I heard you're looking for a Vikhr gun. I could help you out with that, but I'm gonna need a little something from you first.
We'll talk everything out when we're out of here. Need to get out before the stalkers notice anything. Wait for me at the place we've agreed on.
Okay. Here's the key.
Great. Now you head off and wait for me at the meeting point.
Got it. I'm heading out.
Merc, what the hell are you still doing here? Go to the meeting point. Don't waste time.
I'll think about your offer.
So what'll it be, merc? You gonna help us out of this shithole?
I haven't decided yet.
What do you want?
I have the key.
Well, it's nice that you have the key and all, but the moon's not up yet… and we need to get out at nighttime. Come back later; preferably after midnight.
Okay. I'll come back at nighttime.
What do you think? I wanna get out of this hole. If you help me, I could part with it. Don't worry; no one's gonna get whacked. You just need to find the key for this cell.
And how do you want me to go about finding it?

Won't be that hard. There are two keys for this cage: one's held by Saurel while the other is… or, should I say, *was* guarded by Chemist. Chemist's key, however, is being held by Sologub right now. I heard from a stalker that Sologub just leaves his key on his nightstand while he's out like a light. You just need to fetch the key while he's asleep and return the key back to where you took it from once we're out of here. If everything goes as planned, they won't even know a thing.
Sounds like a plan, but how can I trust your offer?

Trust? Ha. You can trust me. I gave you my word, and I always keep it. Especially since you have no way out of this place without a gun… and I have two of those. I'm not looking for any funny business. You won't be getting any gun without my help. They're guarded by quite a serious man, and he gives them only to me. If we get out of here, I'll give them both to you. I swear.
Looks like I have no choice. But if you try to trick me, you're as good as dead.
Rasputin, turn off the radio.
Yeah? Sure. Getting tired of it myself.
Done. Were you building up a headache there?
You don't like my repertoire? That's fine.
Rasputin, turn on the radio.
You want some music? Fine. I don't mind that.
Man, I wouldn't mind listening to a good song myself.
Done. Listen to your heart's content. It's the only thing that's free of charge here.
What the…?! Oh. It's you, merc… Go back to where you came.
As a matter of fact, I came here to help you. Isn't that what you want?
Look, you've been a pain in the ass already. What are you doing poking your nose into other people's business? I should've killed you on the spot while you were doing time. You're going down.
Well, you've said your last word…
Got any work?

What do you think? Of course we do. Not only that, but the job we have is a dirty one. We need six blind dog tails for an assignment from the scientists. We will be very grateful if you help us out with this. Are you in?
Fine. I'll help you with the tails.
Great. And don't worry about the reward; you'll get an honest sum for honest work.
Got it. I'll be off.
Nothing so far.
Greetings, merc. Do you have any business here?
Greetings, merc. Do you have any business here?
You got the six blind dog tails?
Yes. I have the tails. Here you go.
Nothing so far.
Great. You helped me good. Here's your honest reward.
Thanks. I'll be going now.

Well, anyone could've done it. Listen: I went on a hike with Lame not long ago, and the Zone gave us a special gift. Basically, we stumbled upon a load of artifacts and crammed it all into a container that we agreed to hide. From there, we split up. Lame managed to return to the base before I did. All in all, we were feeling happy and generous, so we shared a few drinks with another couple of stalkers. Next, the dimwit tells me that he brought the container to the base. I lost my temper and pushed him over.\n \nThat's when the conflict started. Rasputin messaged me thereafter, saying that the container was gone. Whoever stole the container made it look like I was the guilty one so that the stalkers would go after me instead.
Who do you think is behind it?

I have no idea. I know for sure that it couldn't have been Rasputin, Skew, or, obviously, Saurel. Beast, I beg you, go explain everything to Saurel. I don't want things to be like this. I'm not afraid to die, but I don't want to die as a rat.
I'll go talk to him, then get back to you.
You won't be able to contact me; I lost my PDA somewhere while escaping the bandits.
Then stay here and don't move. I'll come back here.
Beast, I beg you, speak to Saurel about letting me back. Okay?
Fine. I'll speak to him.
Hey, who are you?
I'm Beast. I came here for you. Any last words?
Damn it! So Saurel sent you here? Don't think I ever saw you in the base before.
I arrived yesterday while you were slipping away.

Oh, I didn't slip away anywhere. I just went for a walk to relax. Then Rasputin sent me a message about Lame's death. Everyone thought I was the killer, and then the bandits went after me, and I couldn't go back. And no… I didn't kill Lame. He was like a brother to me.
Only you would've had any reason to do it.
Well, yeah. We had a bit of an argument, but I wouldn't go as far as to kill a man because of some disagreements.
Then who could've done it?
So, Beast, you ready to deal with those fanatics?
I'm ready, though why did you decide to get mixed up in all of this?
I wanted to help you out and thank you for everything that you did for me. It means a lot, and Sologub's too short on experience to go on such missions.
Hmm… Well, all right. Can we go?

Yeah. We'll get going right away; Petrovich already reconfigured my PDA. I don't recommend taking the road that goes by the school. There are tons of anomalies there. Better stay on the path that stretches from the factory; it's longer but safer.
I'll support you. Let's move.
This is all very strange…
Well, then. I'm guessing that scumbag lied to us and there won't be any meeting?
It seems that way…
Fuck! It's an ambush! Beast, get to cover ASAP! We'll cover you!
What are you talking about? I'm staying with you!

No! Beast, we're too few. We won't last five minutes in these numbers. Get to the stalkers and call for assistance right now. Only you can convince them to help us. Go on! Get out of here! Time is short. Don't worry about the exit! We'll cover you!
I'm off, Miklukha! You stay here, and I'll get you some people.

So, we have some time before meeting with the Monolith. One more thing: we have to wait for the deal to begin, and then we smack that scum. Most importantly, we take out everyone and everything, and let no one escape. If anyone survives and runs off, then… Basically, we're screwed.
It'll be all right. Just don't make any fuss before we get our chance.
Yeah. You nervous?
Not at all. When are we kicking it off?

Right now, Spotty's hiding in one of the terminals while we stay in the shop. We'll go through the northern entrance of the factory; it'll be safer that way. On the way there, we need to clear the vicinity of any mutants so that they don't come after us later when the fighting starts. You'll come with me and help me out. I recommend you bring a silencer; it won't do us any good if we attract attention.
Understood. Let's move.
It's quiet here… Too quiet. The fanatics should have set up a perimeter already, but there's not a soul here.
Tell me a story, brother.

My brother, the Monolith summoned me this night. I spoke with it. It was glorious in its splendor. I was almost blinded by its light, which endowed me with great vigor! I sense its might dwelling amongst us! It told me that only ardent faith is capable of vanquishing the wicked. It said that only the faithful will be blessed with its power. Furthermore, it revealed to me that our victory is impending!

My brother, have you heard that several infidels snuck near the antennas recently? The Monolith guided us, and my brethren noticed them in time. One fell and evaporated. We've eliminated the second, and the third took off running. Cowards. They're all cowards. Only true faith leaves no space for fear! Two ran away, but the Monolith is shrewd and omniscient. Hence, it needs them alive.

I recall us patrolling the edges of the Red Forest and stumbling upon a lone infidel. He had already started turning, and we did not kill him, but he was still existent in this half-beastly state… I realize that the sage Monolith has done it for us all: once again, he unmasked for us the true face of our enemy. Now our faith has been hardened yet further! It is nearing, my brother! The victory over the infidels is nearing, and then the Monolith shall fulfill our innermost desire! Rightfully shall it bless the devout with its presence; its glory; its magnificence! May we forever dwell in its brilliance!

Not long ago, the Monolith tested my faith, and I nearly wandered off the righteous path. But I withstood! Praise the Monolith! Its challenges forge us! We were on our way back from the Dark Valley, and I fell slightly behind my brethren. The evil took this advantage and promptly started enticing me. And… I hesitated. The pure images were corrupted; the enemy whispered to me that we were merely slaves to the Monolith. But then it occurred to me: this was a challenge. I remembered the Monolith's shine and might, and my will, my courage was restored. Since then, I fear no challenge and know no hesitation. Praise the Monolith!

I've been in the Dark Valley. The infidels are abundant there, since the Monolith's power hasn't reached those lands yet. We had been on guard duty. At night, we were attacked. We fought those animals fiercely. My brethren's prowess was honored: the Monolith summoned them soon after. But for me, he prepared another challenge. My weapon would not fire. But then the Monolith said: “You are with me, and my strength is with you. If you stay true to your faith, you shall crush your foes and move nearer to me!” And I became a shadow. I crouched and crept towards their right side. The daft, foolish spies were blind to it. They thought they'd finish us and laugh over the hollow bodies of our brethren. But I had already faced their backs. And the Monolith's force struck them out of my hands. Thus it killed them. I am gleeful to serve you, the supreme one!
I have nothing more to share with you, brother.
What do you want, fresh meat? Was gonna hit the sack right before you showed up…
You'll get your beauty sleep later… I want to know how long I've been here. What is this place?
Uh-huh. Good luck with that.
Yeah. Night.
The hell you on about? Did the stalkers hit you over the head?
Thing is, I don't remember how I got here…

Our guy told me that you got out of a bubble with the stalkers… Well, congrats! You managed to get from one cage to another. In case you didn't figure it out, you're at the Outpost now. You've spent no more than an hour in the stalker base. But don't worry; you didn't miss anything. He he.
Why the hell am I behind bars?
You weren't lucky. Neither was our bro. By the way, Saurel heard a lot about you, so he put you in the best room they got.
Who's Saurel?
Like, that bastard's the head of this camp. You'll get to talk to him. Until then, go get some sleep. I don't wanna hear any more of your questions.
Fine. I'll have to wait until morning anyway. Maybe Savage will have a chance to speak to this Saurel.
Listen closely, merc. I'll only say this once: Saurel is letting you go, but don't do anything stupid, or you'll pay for it. Severely. Got it?
Understood, sir. In that case, may I have my equipment?
Of course. Here's everything that you carried.
Excellent. Where is my group?

Well, part of your group is in the base, while the others have left the Outpost with a guide. Some other guy, Markus, got lost somewhere. Your friend, Savage, tells me that he ended up in an anomaly and never escaped. Go talk to him; I might've missed a few details. Oh, and by the way, go talk to Saurel. He wants to talk to you about something important.
Got it. Release me.

Well, part of your group is in the base, while the others have left the Outpost with a guide. Some other guy, Markus, got lost somewhere. Your friend, Savage, tells me that he ended up in an anomaly and never escaped. Go talk to him; I might've missed a few details. Oh, and by the way, go talk to Saurel. He wants to talk to you about something important.
Got it. Release me.
I almost forgot: your Duty buddy wanted you to have this canteen. Here.
Thank you. Open the door.
I've got a few things of interest. You buying?
Show me what you've got.
It's the guy who was with you in the spatial anomaly, right? Savage told me about him. I'll give you fifteen hundred rubles for that PDA.
Well, it might be useful. Have a thousand rubles for this scribble. No more.
Excellent.
Nothing so far.
Chemist's old knife.
Chemist's PDA.
The PDA of a stalker from the Final Day faction.
Scavenger's PDA.
A note from Gray.
Finally decided to sell something? You can have forty-five hundred for that. A beautiful knife, indeed.
Hmm… Interesting… Have two thousand rubles for it. You can never have too much information.
What the!… Where did you get that? Uh, never mind. Don't tell me. I still want to rest easy at night. You can have seven thousand for it.
I'm out of water. Could you refill my canteen?
Of course, but it'll set you back two thousand rubles. Water purification's not a simple business, you know. So, deal?
Deal. Have two thousand.
No. I changed my mind.

Great. Your order is already up. I knew you would come to get some water, so I refilled a few canteens beforehand. Right now, I'll refill the empty one that you just brought me. Come back any time you need water.
All right. I'll drop by.
No. I wasn't that far away when I was keeping an eye on you. At first, you fiddled with some kind of device, and then you stood up and started talking to yourself without moving a muscle.
What are you saying? You sure you aren't mixing up any of this?

No. I haven't lost my mind just yet. Hear me out: you collapsed, and then I heard a horrifying laugh… Some figure with a black trenchcoat knelt beside your body. So I waited a bit longer, then ran out and popped a few shots at the guy, but he disappeared in an instant. After that whole freakshow, I brought you back to base. It took me two trips; one for you and one for all your belongings.
Thank you so much, man. If there's anything I can do for you, let me know.
I'll keep that in mind. Now, can you tell me what you saw? Did you think you were talking to someone?

Yes… Petrovich gave me a transmitter so I could send the coordinates to an exit to a few stalkers in the space bubble. After that was done, the stalkers appeared in front of me. It was Fish and his men.
What “Fish”? Did you know this guy?

Yeah. When I had just gotten into the Zone, he saved me and got me to join up with the mercenaries. Eventually, Fish was cast out from the Syndicate, and he expected me to come with him. I stayed. Fish blamed me for it and made it clear that we would see each other again. I didn't hear from Fish for the longest time, but then someone messaged me and told me that he and his squad were found dead in Yantar. And this whole time, I thought he was dead.
So he's most likely dead.
But I saw him with my own two eyes.
Come to your senses? That's great. How are you holding up?
There was no one near you. That's for sure.

I might as well tell you another thing: the figure you saw next to me; I met him before in the space bubble. He's very dangerous. It's good you showed up and saved me when you did. Thank you again. Now excuse me. I need to have a word with Petrovich.
So that's what it was… Listen: I suggest you keep your mouth shut about this creature, lest there be any misunderstandings. I'm also gonna keep quiet about it.
You're right. See you later!
What is it, merc?
S-S-Shit… Not very well.
Could've been worse. Guess I saved you there. Had I not been there in time, you would've been a goner.
So I owe you with my life?
Guess you could say that. Good thing I had the guts to do that. Otherwise, I can't imagine what would've happened.
Can you tell me what happened? Where's the trio that tried to kill me?
I was just about to tell you that there was no one near you.
You found me when I was passed out?
Well, well… What have we here? Could it be Beast? Long time no see…
Hello, Fish…
Didn't expect to see me again, did you? He he. I told you we'd meet again.
I didn't expect you to come out of the bubble.
And why do you think we got lucky? We came back from a place that's worse than hell. And for what?
I have no idea.
Debts must be paid. And you'll pay for them with your blood!
Don't even start…
That's good… And I think I'm gonna have a drink…
What made you start drinking?
What?… Do I need a reason?…
No, but I can tell you have a reason. Come on; spill the beans and tell me what happened.
It's all stupid… Came here with Sashka a long time ago; one of the first stalkers. He knew the whole area like the back of his hand. Ugh…
What happened?

I somehow got into an argument with him. And he… decided to go on a raid on his own, while I stayed in the base… and Sashka never returned. I looked for him for a looong time, but there was no trace of him anywhere. But not long ago, I saw him. Or rather what was left of him…
Nothing you can do about it. And you better lay off the booze.

Yeah, I get it… Can you help me, buddy? I saw Sashka around a group of zombies. He became one of them. Probably somewhere in the field of that… Whatchamacallit? He ended up in that terrible psy-emission, and it fried his brains right off the bat. Put his soul to rest, won't you? I can't watch my friend suffer together with other good men. Can't do anything about it myself, either. Can't even lift my hand…
Don't worry. I'll take care of it.
Aha! W-What? What do you want?
Thaaank you so much. I won't forget about this. The zombies are in the graveyard. Not far from the base… I'll give you a marker…
Send it and I'll go.
W-What? Any news?
I put your friend out of his misery, along with his friends in the graveyard.
T-That's great… Thanks, man… I won't forget this… Take this…
Thanks for the shooter. Take my advice, Skew: get off the booze. Drinking all day long help your friend come back.
W-W-What do you want?
Nothing so far.
How'd you get so shit-faced?
Eeeh… Had to… He he.
What are you laughing at?
Yeeeah… Just remembered a funny joke. Ugh. It's so boring here…
Can I help you with anything?
Weeell, help me, then. Let's… Let's have a drink…
No, thanks. I've stopped drinking.
Are you Baldy? I need to talk to you.
That's me. What do you need?
What's done is done. Best to fulfill your friend's last wish.
Spotty asked me to find you. You know him?
Spotty? Crap. What happened to him? He's still alive?
No. He lost his mind and killed himself. He was in terrible condition. I couldn't make out anything he said.
No, no, no! Was there anyone else with him?
He was alone. He talked nonsense about the Scorcher and some Humpback…
This is all my fault… Humpback and Spotty were doomed because of me. In the heat of it all, I left them and ran off.
Tell me what happened.

Humpback, Spotty, and I spent a long time preparing to break through the north. We didn't have enough time to wait for the Scorcher to cool down, and Spotty acquired some information from a member of Final Day. From Swede, it seems.
 
We were halfway through the Red Forest when the Scorcher turned on without warning. Spotty lost it; he went unconscious, fell off a slope, and after that, disappeared somewhere. He wasn't where he should've been after the fall. No reply on my PDA, either. I panicked and decided on abandoning the mission and going back. Humpback was dead set on finding Spotty, but that would've been suicide for us. Still, I went with Humpback's plan. He descended the slope to look for Spotty where he should've been. And then the Scorcher hit us.
 
I regained consciousness outside a military base. Until now, I figured they were both dead…
What's done is done, Baldy. Don't punish yourself for the past.
Spotty asked me to find you. And hand you this artifact.
Spotty? Crap. What happened to him? So he's still alive?
No. He lost his mind and killed himself. He was in terrible condition. I couldn't make out anything from him.
No, no, no! Was there anyone else with him?
He was alone. He was raving about the Brain Scorcher and some Humpback. Then he asked me to bring you this artifact and told me that you would pass it on to his wife.
This is all my fault… Humpback and Spotty were doomed because of me. In the heat of it all, I left them and ran off.
Tell me what happened.

Humpback, Spotty, and I spent a long time preparing to break through the north. We didn't have enough time to wait for the Scorcher to cool down, and Spotty acquired some information from a member of Final Day. From Swede, it seems.
 
We were halfway through the Red Forest when the Scorcher turned on without warning. Spotty lost it; he went unconscious, fell off a slope, and after that, disappeared somewhere. He wasn't where he should've been after the fall. No reply on my PDA, either. I panicked and decided on abandoning the mission and going back. Humpback was dead set on finding Spotty, but that would've been suicide for us. Still, I went with Humpback's plan. He descended the slope to look for Spotty where he should've been. And then the Scorcher hit us.
 
I regained consciousness outside a military base. Until now, I figured they were both dead…
What do you want, merc? I'm not really in the mood for chit-chat…
Glad you're still in one piece, merc. I won't be questioning you about what happened at the factory; if you have anything to share, just say it.
It's all right. Don't let it go to your head. What info did Miklukha have on his PDA?

Okay. Let's take a look at what's on there. Petrovich didn't manage to decrypt all of the entries, but we managed to find some useful information nonetheless. Miklukha had a spare plan for driving the Monolith out of the Outpost. It was rather simple: acquire a Monolith disguise, infiltrate their base, and destroy the structure with explosives. I think this plan deserves a try, but first, we need to get hold of a Monolith bodysuit, as well as one of their PDAs. That task will be up to you and Sologub. After you find a disguise, meet up with Sologub at their base, set up the explosive charges, then detonate them and return back here. That's the plan.
Not a bad idea, but where do I get two Monolith outfits?

I checked all my channels. There's a trader offering us two Monolith suits, but in exchange, he wants an SR-3 Vikhr assault rifle. I have no clue where to find it. Rasputin's suppliers can't get a hold of it, either. Can you check your channels?
My channels won't be of any help. After what happened in the space bubble, it's best to not contact the Syndicate at all.
That's bad, but still, try to ask around about this. Perhaps we might find a Vikhr.
Fine. I'll try to get a hold of it. We'll talk later.
What is it, merc?
What is it, merc?

Beast, where have you been? Shit's happened. The bandits that were in the cage escaped last night. What I don't understand is how they were able to get out in the first place. I have a suspicion one of my men helped them. You haven't noticed anything recently, have you?
Nope. Haven't noticed anything… By the way, I've got the rifle for the trader.
All right. I'll deal with the escape later. Where'd you get that shooter?
Well… Some old contacts helped me out…

Very good. Now we can bring Miklukha's plan to life and wipe out the Monolith once and for all.\n \nOh, yeah: we decrypted another entry on Miklukha's PDA. Turns out there's a laboratory under the Outpost that's used by the Monolith to bring in munitions and new fighters.
This just keeps getting better… So first, we need to strike at their base in the construction site. We'll continue from there.
Piece of cake. We'll need to wait for the bodysuits, though. Don't know how long it'll take for them to arrive. Give me the rifle; I'll send it to the trader in exchange for the package.
Okay. Here you are.
The Freedomers are pinned down by the Monolith at the factory. I need your help, Saurel. Give me a few good men so I can help Miklukha.
Great. You can go. As soon as I receive the package with the suits, I'll contact you.
Understood. See you.
The package is still on the way, Beast. Drop by later, okay?
Great news, Beast! The package with the outfits has arrived. Now we can get to work and carry out our previously mentioned plan. You ready?
Guess I'm ready.
I know, I know: the plan's not ideal, and there's a chance they'll see through it, but that chance is small as all hell. Monolithians are mindless; they won't realize it's a setup.
All right. Where's Sologub right now? Is he good to go?

Ah, yeah: regarding Sologub, he's not going with you… Savage, on the other hand, was itching to be his replacement. At first, I didn't agree to it, but in the end, I figured things would be easier with him by your side. He's already donned a bodysuit, and is waiting for you downstairs. First, though, go see Petrovich. He'll reconfigure yours and Savage's PDAs.
Sorry, but I can't risk my own men. You got out, and that's what's matters. The rest do not. We're not close enough to Freedom to die for their sake.
Give me the rundown once more, then I'll go talk to Petrovich.

All right. Here's the plan: you and Savage will infiltrate the Monolith base. Once you're in, you'll attach the explosive charges to the column on the second floor of the building while Savage tries to distract the Monolith. After you set the charges, return to our base immediately so you don't end up like them. That's the plan. Now take your Monolith bodysuit and the charges. Break a leg, you two.
We'll get this done.
The package has yet to arrive, Beast. Drop by later, okay?
What happened there, Beast? Where's Savage?

We were compromised… Seems the Monolith took away Savage into the laboratory, and now they're waiting for me to come save him. I don't know what they thought up, but they need to lure me into the laboratory for something.
Well, then… Sad to see such a good plan lead to failure… So there's one thing I don't understand: how do you know they brought Savage into the laboratory?
They knocked me out. When I came to, there was no one at the Monolith base except for a single Monolith fighter. He told me about it all.
How can you say that? If we don't help them right this instant, they'll die.
So there are no more Monolith at the base? Did they all leave?
Yeah, but I doubt they're leaving for good…

As I understand it, you're setting out to rescue Savage, right? I doubt it'll be worth it. It's suicide. Just forget about it. On top of that, Hunter arrived at the farm half an hour ago. He was looking for you; said he's ready to get you out of the Outpost. Just go to him. Savage is history by now.
I need to save Savage. I can't just leave him behind.
Perhaps you'll reconsider that ridiculous notion of yours? If you head into the laboratory, you're as good as dead…
I need to save Savage.
Perhaps you're right. There's no guarantee Savage is still alive…
Exactly! My advice is to go to Petrovich. He'll reset your PDA. After that, get out of that damn Monolith outfit and go see Hunter. Just don't go down into that laboratory.
All right. So be it. I'll talk to Petrovich and then see Hunter.
They're probably dead by now. I can't risk losing my men, Beast.
Good luck, Beast! I hope we see each other again…
Hello, Beast. Have you managed to find any clues on where to get that SR-3 Vikhr?
Seems like it. One of the bandits in the farm cell told me that if I free them, he'll get me a Vikhr.
Those slippery bastards… Can't we just put needles under their nails and get the location of the weapons that way?

They asked me to steal Sologub's key at nighttime and hand it to them. In exchange, they're giving me the gun. They also promised not to use any force; instead, they'll just sneak out without any fuss.
So that's how it is… What do you think? Can we trust them to keep their word?
I think we can trust them.
I don't really think the bandits are trustworthy, but we have no other options right now.
Ah, shit… Fine. I'll try to save them myself.

We've come this far… You'll have to go along with their plan. However… I have an idea: we can play along with the bandits. I'll give you the key to the cage. You pass it on to the bandits, and I'll warn the guys on the farm so they'll be ready for anything. If everything goes as planned and the bandits keep their word, we'll let them live, but we don't want to see them ever again. Does that sound good to you, Beast?
Sounds like a plan. Better than just stealing the key for the bandits.
I doubt that'll work. The bandit told me the guns are held by a third party. I can only get them if the bandits are set free.
What goddamn freedom plan did that bandit have in mind for you?
Okay, so, let's do it like this: you take the key, tell them you stole it from Sologub, and after the “escape,” you come back to me and tell me everything. Sound good?
Sounds good. Let's do it.
How did it go, Beast?
The bandits escaped. No fuss, no muss. They told me I can come for the Vikhr at the old school in the morning. Here's your key.
Well, then. Let's see if they keep their word…
We'll find out in the morning. No use in guessing.
Well, Beast. Did the bandits keep their word? Did you get the gun?
Yes, surprisingly. They kept their word. I have the SR-3 Vikhr.

Very good. Now we can bring Miklukha's plan to life and wipe out the Monolith once and for all. Oh, yeah, we decrypted another entry on Miklukha's PDA. Turns out there's a laboratory under the Outpost that's used by the Monolith to acquire munitions and new fighters.
This just keeps getting better… Anyway, first we need to strike at their base in the construction site. We'll go on from there.
The bandits escaped. No fuss, no muss. They told me I can come for the Vikhr at the old school in the morning. Now I'll go return both your key and Sologub's key.
What is it, merc?
What is it, Beast?
Let's chat after you give the key to the bandits. All right?
All right. I'm going.
Listen, Rasputin: I'm looking for a rifle. It's called the SR-3 Vikhr. Can you get a hold of it?
I already spoke to Saurel about that. I can only tell you the same thing: my suppliers don't have the means to acquire that rifle. It's a very rare piece.
Okay. Thanks for the answer.
Not at all. If you ever need help, come see me.
I'm looking for an SR-3 Vikhr. Do you know where to find it?

You gonna get it in exchange for those Monolith suits from the trader? Nah. I don't know. There's one thing I can tell you: if Rasputin can't find that rifle, there's not much of a chance anyone else will. Sorry, but it's the truth.
Hey, Skew, I need an SR-3 Vikhr. Know where to find it?
N-No… No idea… I don't need your p-problems… I already h-have my own……
Looking for an SR-3 Vikhr. Know where I can find it?
No clue. If Rasputin can't help you with that, go see Petrovich. Maybe he can get it for you.
Hi, Petrovich. I'm trying to find an SR-3 Vikhr rifle. Any chance you can get a hold of one?
Hmm. No. I won't be able to find one, and I doubt anyone else at the Outpost can.
